intro: Erythroxylum ulei, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces berries that range in color from red to black, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded or semi-shaded conditions.
